content: My $0.02: Imagine a group of people playing Monopoly. They are obsessed. They rejoice when they pass Go and collect $200. They despair when they have to pay rent. They are anxious when its their turn to roll the dice, they hope when they land on Chance, they breath a sigh of relief when they land on Free Parking. The “goal” of meditation is not to help them become more successful at Monopoly. The “goal” of meditation is not to help them better handle the emotions that arise from playing Monopoy. The “goal” is not even to persuade them that the game is just an illusion. The “goal” of meditation is simply to help them understand how they and the game of Monopoly fit into the larger reality of which they are all a part.
